alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Orange; Washington; Western Addison; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Orange, northeastern Addison, southeastern Chittenden, northwestern Windsor and southwestern Washington Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lincoln, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Warren, Bristol, Northfield, Moretown, Lincoln, Waitsfield, Fayston, Roxbury, Braintree, Granville, Buels Gore, Bethel, New Haven, Middlesex, Ripton, Berlin, Starksboro, Duxbury, Rochester, and Irasville. This includes Interstate 89 near mile marker 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central, southern and northwestern Vermont.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Orange; Washington; Western Addison; Western Windsor
